body:
> Resolve the conversations which are fixed and see if anything is pending.

Added all the requested changes
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
@thesmallstar Resolved all the conversations which are fixed

> @ptuomola @xurror @luckyman20 @awasum Giving another day to this, just in case you have any suggestions. WIll merge tomorrow.

Thanks, everyone for the review, merging this now.
Tests green, merging.
Tests green, merging.

> Sometimes the tests may be a bit "flaky" - you may want to retrigger a build to see if that works better...

do other contributors have option to trigger the build without pushing new commit to this PR??

> > Sometimes the tests may be a bit "flaky" - you may want to retrigger a build to see if that works better...
> 
> do other contributors have option to trigger the build without pushing new commit to this PR??

okay, I got it. I closed and opened the PR for triggering it again.
@thesmallstar @ptuomola @luckyman20 Would you mind reviewing this?  Thanks :)
@francisguchie  and @bharathc27  Please can you find time to test this one functionally? Looks interesting.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
@ptuomola  Maybe we should just merge this one if it Look Good. Than to let the bot auto close it again.
@thesmallstar Please review
Will be opening a new PR. Closing now

@awasum Yes, at a quick glance this looks good. I just didn't do anything on this as the comment says "Work in progress". Also the build seems to be failing (could be unrelated) and the comments would need to be squashed. @josemakara2  would you have a chance to finish this off, and we can then merge?
@thesmallstar Please review

Hi @fynmanoj  Sorry for the delay. There are now merge conflicts on the PR. 

@francisguchie , @bharathc27 you can test this function together with the UI changes found here: https://github.com/openMF/community-app/pull/3381
@awasum , I have rebased the PR

@ptuomola  Does this LGTY? This one seem to have resolved itself over time? Or what?

Let me refresh and let it run again.

Trying to Reopen this for review. Seem another PR was opened in its place. This seems to contain commits fixing 2 different issues. ITs say the branch was already recreated or forced pushed.. You have to send another PR.
one of the commit is same as that i n another PR : https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/1702, once that is merged, i hall rebase and send this as a new single commit PR

This version of plugin is not compatible with Gradle 6... see https://github.com/hierynomus/license-gradle-plugin/issues/193

Finally got around to fixing the compatibility issues with Gradle 7.x... pretty straightforward changes, could @xurror @vidakovic @vorburger @awasum someone review and merge please?
@BLasan  can you squash the commits and rebase, then I can merge...

> @BLasan can you squash the commits and rebase, then I can merge...

Will do it now. Thanks for the review :)
@ptuomola Done
@ptuomola Could you please review this as well?
Hi @BLasan - looks good, left some comments. Can you have a look, and also rebase & squash please?

@adonay28 I was trying to squash your commits to be able to merge this for you... but looks like I closed your pull request instead. Sorry about this. Can you reopen the pull request and squash the commits? I can then merge this.

Is there a UI component to this?

@ptuomola  Do you have an opinion?
Is there a UI component to this? @Cadreia  @xurror ??
Is there a UI component to this? @Cadreia  @xurror ??

For this feature, there is no actual need for a UI change as it just an improvement on the loan rescheduling algorithm and nothing around the API.

The improvement is more at the level of improving the holiday rescheduling algorithm to work better with long holidays as in the past, the feature would accumulate unpaid loans during holiday periods to a single on the next working day.
With this update, the loans schedule instead get extended.

So same UI from before works for this.

> For this feature, there is no actual need for a UI change as it just an improvement on the loan rescheduling algorithm and nothing around the API.
> 
> The improvement is more at the level of improving the holiday rescheduling algorithm to work better with long holidays as in the past, the feature would accumulate unpaid loans during holiday periods to a single on the next working day.
> With this update, the loans schedule instead get extended.
> 
> So same UI from before works for this.

I have not used the reschedule before but if this is what is being updated, its a +1 from me - This is really a good improvement

> Hi @BLasan - looks good, left some comments. Can you have a look, and also rebase & squash please?

Done. Please review

> @BLasan,
> Is there anything else left

Nothing from my side. LGTM

This is a proposed fix for issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1155
Thanks for contributing to Fineract @Veeshal
@BLasan , I am already using this in live production waiting for the merger
Code generated by openapi generator is incompatible with this version, so we can't merge until the generator has been fixed

### Renovate Ignore Notification

As this PR has been closed unmerged, Renovate will now ignore this update (1.0.2). You will still receive a PR once a newer version is released, so if you wish to permanently ignore this dependency, please add it to the `ignoreDeps` array of your renovate config.

If this PR was closed by mistake or you changed your mind, you can simply rename this PR and you will soon get a fresh replacement PR opened.
This feature is part of a strategy of keeping Fineract vaccinated against pandemic. Read more here.. https://research.muellners.org/holiday-rescheduling/

Looks ok to me - @francisguchie if your testing is OK, then let's merge...
Thanks for the contributing the fix - and taking the time to refactor the code! Great work.

Hi @Cadreia - code looks all good, but looks like the build is failing and there are some merge conflicts. Could you resolve these, squash the commits, put the JIRA issue number into the commit message please, and we can then merge this in? Thanks!
HI @BLasan  - code looks good, but there's a merge conflict and the build was failing. Would you be able to sort these out, and squash the commits please - and we can then merge this. Thanks!

> HI @BLasan - code looks good, but there's a merge conflict and the build was failing. Would you be able to sort these out, and squash the commits please - and we can then merge this. Thanks!

I'll do the refinements. Thanks :) Will you be able to review the post dated checks PR as well?
@ptuomola Would you mind reviewing this as well? Thanks
LGTM... need to check why the build is failing and fix
Code looks ok - need to see why build is failing
This PR is actually from @adonay28 but I accidentally messed up his original PR - hence reopened one for him.
LGTM
Closing this PR for fixing the issues

Hi Awasum,

I will fix it adding the update script. Also I have noticed an error while
running the integraron test in the Pentaho reports.

Regards

***@***.***> escribi:

>

> > @@ -31,9 +31,9 @@ CREATE TABLE `m_template` (
>  DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `m_templatemappers`;
>  CREATE TABLE `m_templatemappers` (
>    `id` BIGINT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
> -  `mapperkey` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
> +  `mapperkey` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8mb4_general_ci DEFAULT NULL,
>
> What happens to old deployments when u update and previous migration file?
> Can we instead update in a newer migration script?
>

@awasum , I have gone through the discussion on [FINERACT-982](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-982), does the PR cater for the non-tech users?
Conflicts have been resolved and build passes now. Please review. Link to the PR for the corresponding UI change is in the description above.

@awasum 

This will work? (of course with the tables affected)

fineract/fineract-provider/src/main/resources/sql/migrations/core_db/Vxxx__alter_m_template_for_utf8mb4_general_ci.sql

Also I would like to propose to set this at DB level, like this

- ./fineract-db/server_collation.cnf:/etc/mysql/conf.d/server_collation.cnf

The file will contain:

fineract-db/server_collation.cnf 
[mysqld]
character_set_server=utf8mb4
collation_server=utf8mb4_general_ci

Any thoughs/suggestions?
I will change the approach, not changing anything on the table collation. I will submit another PR
Hi - is this ready for review, or still work in progress?
It's still WIP. Will submit for review once I'm done.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

Hi @ptuomola, there's an issue related to the changes I've made. `Too many tables; MySQL can only use 61 tables in a join`. Only added an additional column to keep track of share account in transactions. Do we need to move that implementation to a separate table? Or do you have any suggestion to avoid that issue? I was not able to come up with an answer for that after doing numerous investigations.
@avikganguly01 Please review
Is there a unit test for this feature? Seems this has conflicts now...
@Cadreia , @BLasan , will you like to review this PR?

I'll update the PR soon. Found a way to avoid this `mysql join` issue.

Hi @BLasan - thanks. Can you add the JIRA ID to the commit message and assign the JIRA ticket to yourself please - that way  when we create the release notes for the release in JIRA they will contain the right information. Once this has been merged, you should then close the JIRA ticket with appropriate release version.

Upgrading to latest Spring Boot throws up some errors in Spring Security / securityContext. I'm not an expert on this so would be good if someone else could take a look... or alternatively I need to find some time to find out what's going wrong.
Apologies @BLasan - did not notice you were going to review this as well.
Looked OK to me - the only thing I was going to comment on was the commented out code - this should have been cleaned up.
Looks interesting! Can you fix the merge conflicts and squash the commits please, and I'll take a look...
I think there's a problem with the way some of the Multiparts are generated with the new version. Need to find out why this has changed...
Hi @ptuomola, made some changes. Could you please take a look again?

I have fixed the 'RAT' error which was due to licensing issue. But the present error is unavoidable since it is due to duplicate class. Because fineract client generates the SDK in build folder and some replaceable files are automatically moved in their which also reside in src folder of fineract-client.
